techmeme.title: SAP reports Q2 cloud revenue of €4.15B, up 25% YoY, revenue of €8.29B, up 10% YoY, net profits of €918M, and says a "restructuring" will affect ~10,000 jobs (Larry Dignan/Constellation Research)
A look inside Iconiq Growth two months after it closed a $5.75B fund, its largest ever and 42% larger than its previous fund (Jessica Mathews/Fortune)
Google says it won't be "deprecating third-party cookies" in Chrome and will instead keep working on "privacy-preserving alternatives" via Privacy Sandbox APIs (Digiday)
A zero-day in Telegram for Android, patched on July 11, let attackers send malicious Android APK payloads as video files; the exploit was for sale from June 6 (Bill Toulas/BleepingComputer)
An interview with AMD's Mike Clark, who has worked on AMD's CPU architectures for 31 years and led Zen development through all of its five generations (Paul Alcorn/Tom's Hardware)
